intro: Sympetalandra borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean sympetalandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its unique sympetalous (fused) petals that form a corolla. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to the trunks of trees in the dense canopy. Its flowers are small but striking, often displaying vibrant colors that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
